Description: Build command-driven blind intake endpoint and required-field schema for customer identity, location, and issue classification.
AcceptanceCriteria: Create ticket in triaged or schedulable state only when required fields are complete; reject weak identities with escalation flag; emit audit event plus timeline entry; require tests for happy path and required-field failures.

Description: Normalize addresses and deduplicate jobs by account, site, issue signature; prevent accidental duplicates on same caller and location.
AcceptanceCriteria: Canonical case identity key returns stable idempotency for repeated blind submissions; duplicate detector preserves original ticket and writes linkage event; no duplicate open cases for identical payload within threshold.

Description: Move high-confidence intake tickets to schedulable with required follow-up prompt set and state transition auditability.
AcceptanceCriteria: A ticket from triaged to schedulable only happens when classification and contact confidence pass policy; invalid transitions are rejected with explicit reason and correlation id.

Description: Introduce dispatch queue prioritization by region, urgency, promised response SLA, and glass-risk class.
AcceptanceCriteria: Queue ordering is deterministic and explainable; emergency and safety-critical incidents are prioritized above normal jobs; starvation controls visible in timeline.

Description: Implement assignment recommendation using technician certifications, zone mapping, route adjacency, and open load.
AcceptanceCriteria: Dispatch command emits assignment suggestion and selected assignment; assignment without required technician capability or mismatch with area and service type is rejected with policy failure and audit event.

Description: Add customer confirmation and commitment transitions with reschedule/cancel branches and immutable proof hooks.
AcceptanceCriteria: Appointment confirmation transitions only through approved command path; stale confirmations auto-expire to required follow-up; every commitment or reschedule action writes immutable action record and timeline evidence.

Description: Implement dispatcher and technician job packet lifecycle updates for dispatched to onsite to closeout_pending.
AcceptanceCriteria: check-in, notes, parts, labor, and timeline updates are accepted only by technician role; unauthorized role transitions are denied and logged as policy events.

Description: Enforce evidence bundle schema for photo, notes, labor, parts, signature and closeout readiness.
AcceptanceCriteria: Closeout is blocked if required evidence is missing; explicit reason is returned; operator receives actionable escalation task; partial progress can remain closeout_pending when minimum evidence passes gates.

Description: Add blind closeout candidate heuristics with escalation triggers for ambiguity and risk.
AcceptanceCriteria: Low-risk glazing jobs can produce closeout candidate automatically while high-risk jobs require manual closeout approval; every auto-close attempt is logged with justification and evidence scope.

Description: Generate invoice draft artifacts with labor, travel, materials, tax, and status checks from evidence events.
AcceptanceCriteria: Invoice draft is generated only when closeout evidence and signature gates pass; draft references ticket audit id and is immutable except via explicit revision request.

Description: Build production control dashboard and blind-automation alerting including missed SLA, escalation spikes, missing proof, and override usage.
AcceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows real-time state counts by role and urgency; alerts include owner and severity; noise is controlled via threshold and dedupe; on-call drill validates escalation routing.

Description: Create rollout controls for operator override, autonomy pause, rollback, and retention for incident replay.
AcceptanceCriteria: One runbook operation disables autonomous actions by incident type; rollback restores manual mode without timeline loss; all evidence/replay artifacts remain retrievable for review.
